name: bounce off
content: If the first sprite is touching the second sprite, then the first sprite moves away from the second sprite in the opposite direction it was originally moving.

examples.name: Example 1
examples.description: Sprites that are wandering can bounce off of each other.

examples.name: Example 2
examples.description: Sprites that are moving left and right using the `swimming left and right` block can bounce off of each other.

palette_params.name: sprite 1
palette_params.description: The sprite that will bounce off sprite 2

palette_params.name: sprite 2
palette_params.description: The sprite that causes sprite 1 to bounce

short_description: If the first sprite is touching the second sprite, then the first sprite moves away from the second sprite in the opposite direction it was originally moving.
tips:
* This block works best under the [`sprite touches sprite`(#62fc94)](/docs/spritelab/gamelab_whenTouching/) event for sprites with behaviors that use the [`move forward`(#5ef3ff)](/docs/spritelab/gamelab_moveForward/) block such as “wandering” or “swimming left and right”.
* If a sprite is programmed with [`move in direction`(#5ef3ff)](/docs/spritelab/gamelab_moveInDirection/) blocks, this block does not change the selected direction.
